title: why is the oce server so bad

embed.description: Super simple and lightning fast image sharing. Upload clipboard images with Copy & Paste and image files with Drag & Drop

body: just look at the ping strikes, not on my end my ping is actually about 30ms and i get 57ms which is absolutely fine, but these pings strikes are un-playable and not fun at all.

replies.body:
This might actually be a problem with WTFast. I'll forward this to some Wrenchmen and get their opinion on it.

I've seen some reviews that claim WTFast working great, but there's also many reviews where people claim it's making their ping spike like crazy (example [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/30jhi0/voyboys_perspective_on_wtfast_situation/cpt0ass) .)

Have you tried playing League with WTFast disabled/uninstalled? Is your ping stable when you do that?
Thanks man, I think I'm too tilted for my games to go well though XD
yes i have, it was actually worse. i couldnt leave 500ping range.

Oh yay, someone using what the useless.

>Why should I use WTFast?

>WTFast uses an intelligent server network to route your game connection.  Our service focuses on creating the best connection possible for gaming, and only gaming!  If you care about your connection, and want the best online experience possible, then you NEED to use WTFast!  

So basically let's break down what this actually means.

Your connection to league of legends generally goes through several different IP's and such to get to where it needs to, WTF basically tries to make this route shorter.

The problem being, WTF can't actually change what your ISP want's you to go through (which is in most cases the actual problem) and can only produce minor results when it comes to gaming in Australia in general.

I have a suggestion for you.

Go to here https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2 And run the Tracert for the OCE server, it gives you all the information you will need to actually talk with riot to try and find out the problem you are facing (however it could just be distance to the server depending on where you live)

This will enable you to be able to find out if it's an ISP issue, a riot issue, or any issue inbetween and go towards fixing it.

WTFast actually doesn't work and it has been proven (based on my readings and stuff) but one thing that worked for me was using the Ethernet cable which was basically connecting your laptop/desktop to the router directly and using LAN, ping went down from 150 to 30
i am unable to do this, otherwise i would have done it.

Hey there,

This sounds like it might be a problem with your ISP, however let's first rule out anything on your end by having you run through the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) support article, if nothing there helps could you please do the following for me.

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
